instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
I have this machine that takes time to turn on, I already reprogrammed bios and format but still the problem continues.

When the machine is in sleep and you press any key to bring up the image, it freezes and reboots, "displaying a screen in three languages and Chinese letters"

Inspecting the area of <CHIP>U4200</CHIP> it looks good but there is a voltage that I am missing from the BUCK "L4202" I have that voltage in 453mv.

The other Bucks show their correct voltages, I don't have another plate to see if that voltage should be present or is.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did you check that voltage at <CAPACITOR>C4208</CAPACITOR>?

Do you mean sleep by closing lid?
Check <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> voltages, when comes back from sleep (open lid).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 90523, member: 682"]
Did you check that voltage at <CAPACITOR>C4208</CAPACITOR>?

R: that's right, I just checked with another board and it has the same voltage at boot time.

Do you mean sleeping with the lid closed?

R: that's right, the machine takes time to turn on, once it is in the user window, after a while it goes to sleep, when it starts again it freezes and restarts.

Check <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> voltages, when comes back from sleep (open lid).
[/QUOTE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Fans spin normal, or start with max speed?
Disconnect J9600 and test with USB macOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: the fans rotate normally, remove the j9600 and use external usb with catalina, "something curious" when it starts it does not show the apple but the progress bar appears. It does not enter the system externally but to the recovery mode, it does not have a boot security utility.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did PRAM reset?
Is there EFI password?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
yes brother, also reprogram bios and still the same.

The recovery mode loads quickly without problem, the problem is when starting the system and when you are going to turn it off, it also takes time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did you clean ME in BIOS?
Can you access boot menu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: try with clean bios. If I can access the boot menu without problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: place the complete motherboard in another case, to rule out that it was some peripheral. but equal. The same problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode?
Also check values reported by HWMonitor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
I passed the diagnostic mode but it did not throw any error code. Activity monitor does not show anything abnormal.

What I have noticed is that when the "about this mac" window is opened, that WINDOW is frozen, but not the machine.

That is, I cannot close the window that shows information about the machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xXgXuUDgPLgQTYbM_3qnRzQuAbLZfM15/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
Try it as is, do not change serial number.
